chunks.en:
Hello everyone,

I am a complete beginner and have never ridden a road bike before. I am buying a bike for commuting and everyday leisure riding. The commute distance is 10 kilometers.
I am currently considering the following two options:

Decathlon RC100:
Pros: Simple and elegant appearance, relatively affordable price (about 1799 yuan), suitable for beginners.
Cons: There is no Decathlon store locally, and I am worried about maintenance and debugging issues.

Xidesheng AD350:
Pros: Stylish design, promotional price of about 3200 yuan, the budget is barely acceptable.
Cons: I've seen online that it's a popular model, and people say Xidesheng is a pain to repair. Is it really that bad?

Considering my specific situation - there are Giant and Xidesheng stores around my residence, but no Decathlon store - I would like to get your opinions, especially from those with similar experiences or in-depth knowledge of these two brands. Please tell me:

Given my limited budget, which option do you think is more suitable for me, or do you have better recommendations? Thanks ğŸ™
I commute 10km each way and have been cycling to and from work for more than 2 years. The daily commute is mainly on city roads, but there is always a section of bad road under construction.

I tried my friend's road bike. Although the theoretical speed is fast, the traffic lights and frequent potholes on the road make it impossible to pick up speed, and I also have to worry about the bike being damaged.
Later, I decided to get a flat-bar road Giant Escape 1, a very versatile bike suitable for commuting.
Install a rear rack to put your bag and pull things, so you don't have to carry a backpack and get all sweaty.
OP, please take a look.

My personal cycling commute history: electric scooter -> mountain bike -> flat-bar road bike -> drop-bar road bike -> flat-bar road bike -> electric scooter. If you just want to commute and have fun, a flat-bar road bike is the most comfortable. A drop-bar bike is suitable for exercising.
Don't buy too good of a commuter bike, otherwise it's a pity if it gets stolen.
Is the road surface good?
Road bikes are prone to punctures.

chunks.en: I recommend the RC100. The integrated frame is more comfortable to ride. The AD350 is an aerodynamic frame, and the geometry is a bit more aggressive compared to the integrated one. Also, if you have a budget of 3K, you can take a look at the new VOOK ONE bike.

10km, it seems that it may take more than 30 minutes for people who don't exercise often to ride a bicycle for this distance. If you commute by bike every day, it's okay if you're a little tired when you're young, but it's a torture if you're older. I gave up now, and the electric scooter runs every day, so I'm terribly fat ğŸ˜®â€ğŸ’¨
I bought a used AD350 last year. I rode it for hundreds of kilometers and had no problems except for occasional abnormal noises. Of course, I haven't ridden other bikes.

The recommendation is to buy whatever bike shop is nearby. If you're just commuting, don't buy Xidesheng's AD or RS series. Take a look at the flat-bar road bikes in the Speed â€‹â€‹series, which are more comfortable to ride.

It is not recommended for beginners to ride drop-bar bikes. Flat bars fully meet the needs of commuting and handling.
I don't think road bikes that can only run on roads have any meaning. Any electric scooter can overtake you.
Bicycles should be used to ride on some unpaved roads, and even roads where you have to carry the bike are where their advantages can be brought into play.
If you haven't ridden much before, I suggest getting a cheaper mountain bike to get a feel for it. It's not very safe to start with a road bike.
@LuxChen Thanks! I personally think flat bars are a bit ugly haha
